alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 8:44PM EDT until June 22 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Ochlockonee River near Concord (CR 12) affecting Gadsden and Leon Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ochlockonee River near Concord (CR 12). * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Primary access to homes along county highway 12 on the east bank of the river in Leon County may become restricted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 36.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EDT Wednesday was 36.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 34.2 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 36.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.0 feet on 01/28/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 915 AM EDT.
